title: FBI RECORDS for Vincent SICURELLA

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please conduct a search for responsive records and hereby request the following:

Any and all records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into  Vincent SICURELLA (AKA: Jim, AKA: Jimmy)

DOB: 12/23/1940d
DOD:   4/08/2014 

Vincent SICURELLA's Date  of death was on April 8th, 2014. Here is a link to his obituary in the Buffalo News: https://buffalonews.com/obituaries/article_3abd711d-cfb8-5292-acb4-3b81d45b3ffb.html ... Additionally, I have attached a screenshot of his obituary in the Buffalo News. 

BUFFALO LCN CHART: Vincent is listed as a made man in the FBI's 2006 Buffalo LCN Family Chart. This chart indicates Sicurella was 
A. Born on December 23, 1940
B. Had a social security number of: 056-30-4305
 
I have attached a PDF of this 2006 FBI chart. on the Buffalo crime family.

I am asking the following be performed regarding this search: 

1. Please include any and all surveillance pictures and charts containing  and/or referring to Vincent "Jimmy" SICURELLA.  
2. Search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY.
3. In addition to the search at the FBI Field office in Buffalo, NY please conduct a search of the The Central Records System, including but not limited to the following
A. Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, 
B. The Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, 
C. The Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and 
D. The Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices.
4. For the above please conduct a search of both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. 
6. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. 
7. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. 
8. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.
9. In the event that no responsive records are found I ask for a report of the day/time that each of the searches above were made, along with the corresponding results.

Sicurella is alleged to have participated in the Faust Novino hit of 1976.  He received a gun used in this hit from his Uncle Mike John Alessi whose date of death was April 11, 1998. See: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/michael-alessi-obituary?id=4552069

Those alleged to have participated in the hit are:
1. Jospeh Todaro whose date of death was December 26, 2012. See: https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/williamsville-ny/joseph-todaro-5356456
 2. Leonard Falzone whose date of death was November 12, 2016. See: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/leonard-falzone-obituary?id=4833797
3. John Sacco whose date of death was December 9, 1990.  See https://buffalonews.com/news/sacco-is-dead-after-stint-as-fbi-informant/article_1d11df13-4a11-57b3-b3ff-ad0de558a808.html 
4. and Jimmy Sicurella's brother Joseph who died on October 12, 2020. His obituary is here: https://www.amigone.com/obituaries/Joseph-A-Sicurella?obId=18611740

Please do not redact the above individuals from the FBI reports on Jimmy "Vincent" Sicurella 

For participants in the Novino hit See: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-city-councilman-john-al/125477607/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mob

communications.communication:

title: Foreign Service Institute Classes (MENA/Levant)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Foreign Service Institute Classes (MENA/Levant)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The course materials (including but not limited to textbooks, course guides, syllabi, handouts, Powerpoints, slide shows, presentations, audio recordings, or video recordings) for the following Foreign Service Institute classes as of the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 academic years:
- AR194 Islam and the Muslim World
- ASNEA5002  The Levant
- ASNEA5002L The Levant (AS in Language)
- ASNEA5004NL Israel, the West Bank, and Gaza (Non Language)
- ASNEA5004L Israel, the West Bank, and Gaza (Area Studies in Language)
- ASNEA5005 Iran
- ASNEA5005L Iran (Area Studies in Language)
- ASNEA5101 Near East & North Africa Overview
- FT610 Iraq Familiarization

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

If you believe that processing will be faster or more convenient for you by breaking up this request into two or more separate requests, please feel free to reach out. I am happy to discuss, via telephone or email, any adjustments to this request that you believe you aid in your processing.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity.

Again, feel free to contact me with any questions you may have about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: FBI: Sculptor Zurab Tsereteli

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Sculptor Zurab Tsereteli
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau documents related to Zurab Konstantinovich Tsereteli (Georgian: ზურაბ წერეთელი). Tsereteli's (born January 4th 1934 - died April 22nd 2025) recent death was widely reported in the news media. A copy of his obituary in the New York Times should be attached and can be found online here:

https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/27/world/europe/zurab-tsereteli-dead.html

Tsereteli was President of the Russian Academy of Arts at the time of his death. Tsereteli was a controversial figure in his homeland of Georgia, where he was banned from entry for many years due to his closeness with Putin. In addition, Tsereteli was also involved in a plan to install a massive statue of Christopher Columbus in the New York City area. 

Allegations of Tsereteli's connections to organized crime have been widely reported: https://sethhettena.com/2017/05/04/trump-and-the-sculptor-a-tale-of-corruption-organized-crime-and-murder/

This is a request for records about Zurab Tsereteli from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Tsereteli held by the New York or San Juan field offices. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Zurab Tsereteli. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Zurab Tsereteli. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: California Public Records Act (CPRA) request (Sonoma County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Full police reports (not just summaries or redacted versions).

Any and all references to the name "Casey Ann Campbell" in:

To:
Records Division
Sonoma County Sheriff’s Office
Email: sheriff-publicrecords@sonoma-county.org 

cc: Santa Rosa Police Department 
cc: Sebastapol Police Department 

Subject: California Public Records Act Request – Records Pertaining to Casey Ann Campbell

Dear Records Officer,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Cal. Gov. Code § 6250 et seq.), I am requesting access to and copies of all public records and documentation held by your agency pertaining to Casey Ann Campbell, including but not limited to:

Full and unredacted incident/investigation reports

Any and all reports in which the name "Casey Ann Campbell" appears

Audio recordings of 911 calls or dispatch related to these incidents- Phone call reporting harassment and theft from Noah Wilkinson at 1889 Riebli Rd

Body-worn or dash camera footage where “Casey Ann Campbell” was referenced, mentioned, or impersonated

Booking, arrest, or witness records where this name appears

Officer notes, supplemental narratives, and CAD logs

Any correspondence or internal notes regarding impersonation or identity concerns involving this name

I am specifically requesting complete and verbatim transcripts or documentation, including the incident recorded under Case #SD240126001, as well as any associated or related investigations.

If any part of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation citing each specific exemption that applies. I request that any non-exempt portions be provided even if other portions are withheld.

I am willing to pay reasonable copying or media fees, but please inform me in advance if the cost exceeds $50. I would prefer the records be sent electronically to:



Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your response within the time period required by law.

Sincerely,
Casey Ann Campbell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Casey Campbell

title: David Joel Horowitz (January 10, 1939 – April 29, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David Joel Horowitz (January 10, 1939 – April 29, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into FrontPage Magazine editor David Joel Horowitz (January 10, 1939 – April 29, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find a Fox News report on his death at the following link: https://www.foxnews.com/media/conservative-commentator-david-horowitz-dies-86

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. title: MDR Request for PURGE OF GEORGIAN SECURITY OFFICIALS from 19 December 1955

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: MDR Request for PURGE OF GEORGIAN SECURITY OFFICIALS from 19 December 1955
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a MDR (Mandatory Declassification Review) of a CIA document titled, "PURGE OF GEORGIAN SECURITY OFFICIALS" that was a report that was originally distributed on the 19th of December 1955.

A redacted version of this document is available in the CIA's FOIA Reading Room: https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80-00810A008600640003-7.pdf

The report mentions machinations among Soviet security officials in the aftermath of the death of Stalin. Every person mentioned in the report has long since died. The report seems to have mistakenly not redacted Georgy Malenkov's name in one section. This request asks to evaluate the application of the 25X1 exemption in regards to this document - especially if the original release had incorrectly or accidentally not redacted Malenkov's or other individual's names. 

Thank you for the CIA's commitment to transparency and I look forward to working with you until this request is resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Emissions Data Collected under AERR

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Emissions Data Collected under AERR
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emissions data collected from state or local authorities/agencies from January 1, 2018 to March 31, 2025 in the state of Tennessee, segregated county-wise. I am specifically looking for data reported by state or local authorities to the EPA under the Air Emissions Reporting Rule (AERR).

I am requesting data for 5 types of emissions: point, nonpoint, mobile, fires and biogenic sources (point emissions are not included in the National Emissions Inventory data and are crucial to my request).

Some columns that would be helpful are: county, pollutant name, emissions (in tons), pollutant type, SCC code, EIS sector, source description, SCC levels and FIPS code. 

If part of the data is available instead of everything I have asked for, please still send it my way.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hazel Gandhi

title: Obama Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related To Death of Mikhail Lesin

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related To Death of Mikhail Lesin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, news clippings, email threads or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the death of Mikhail Lesin (Russian: Михаил Юрьевич Лесин) and the impact of his death. Time frame from the request is from the date of Lesin's widely reported death in Washington D.C. on November 5th of 2015 to the last day of the Obama Presidency on January 20th of 2017. 

Lesin was the creator behind the Kremlin-backed Russia Today ("RT") media network and was employed by Gazprom-Media. As a wealthy oligarch, he owned numerous properties in the United States and was connected to high profile figures in the entertainment industry. Theories about his death were later mentioned in the widely disseminated "Steele dossier."

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: [Westerly, RI] Stop of driver for middle finger

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: [Westerly, RI] Stop of driver for middle finger
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request relates to a February 10, 2025 incident involving Corporal Gregory Burbank, Kolby Bostick, and Officer Allen (Badge No. 80), and a driver (last name "Attwood" or "Atwood"). One body camera video of the incident includes an Axon watermark stating that it was recorded on "2025-02-10 14:11:40 -5:00" BY "AXON BODY 3 X60AB786S".

I request:

1. Any body camera recording by any officer at the scene of the incident.

2. Any vehicular-mounted camera recording of the incident, or recorded within fifteen minutes before the stop began.

3. Any citation given to the driver.

4. Any Westerly Police Department policy concerning the use of body cameras or vehicular cameras.

5. Any Westerly Police Department policy which mentions "free speech", "freedom of speech", "free expression", "freedom of expression", or "First Amendment."

6. Any training materials, handouts, slides, sign-in sheets, logs, or other documents used in any Westerly Police Department training involving the First Amendment since January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Adam Steinbaugh

title: GSA policies on "profanity" or "inappropriate" language in comments on Regulations.gov

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: GSA policies on "profanity" or "inappropriate" language in comments on Regulations.gov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All current (as of the date of this request) GSA policies, guidelines, rules, or standards used to determine whether comments (or other materials) submitted to Regulations.gov contain "profanity," "inappropriate" language, or otherwise unacceptable content, resulting in the deletion or exclusion of such comments from public view.

2. Any internal memoranda, training materials, manuals, or other documents issued or utilized by GSA staff concerning the identification and handling of comments (or other materials) submitted to Regulations.gov determined to be profane, inappropriate, or otherwise unacceptable for posting.

3. Records identifying any automated tools, software, or algorithms used by the GSA or contracted entities for scanning, flagging, or deleting comments to Regulations.gov based on profanity or inappropriate content.

4. Records reflecting the number of comments to Regulations.gov removed or withheld from posting due to profanity or inappropriate content from January 1, 2023, to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Executive Order 14185 ("Restoring America's Fighting Force") Report on DEI initiatives

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Executive Order 14185 ("Restoring America's Fighting Force") Report on DEI initiatives
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns Executive Order 14185 ("Restoring America’s Fighting Force"), available at https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/03/2025-02181/restoring-americas-fighting-force. I request a copy of the report required by Section 5 of the Executive Order, which provides: "Department of Defense Internal Review.  The Secretary of Defense shall conduct an internal review that documents actions taken in pursuit of DEI initiatives, including all instances of race and sex discrimination and activities designed to promote a race- or sex-based preferences system.  The report shall be delivered to the Secretary of Defense within 90 days of the date of this order."

That report was due on or before April 27, 2025.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

The Department has previously granted FIRE expedited processing. See, e.g., FOIA No. 25-F-2201.

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely an Executive Order requiring a report to the Secretary of Defense.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis because it concerns the Secretary's implementation of a presidential policy priority, and because the public's feedback may impact the final report required of the  Task Force's final report required of the Secretary of Defense to the Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy on or before July 26, 2025. (See Sec. 7(b) of the Executive Order.)  If that information is only disclosed months or years later, it will inhibit the ability of the public to understand how its current officials are making decisions.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles:

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/pentagon-intelligence-arm-dia-pausing-dei-mlk-holocaust-remembrance-and-other-observations/
https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-signs-executive-orders-banning-radical-gender-ideology-dei-initiatives-military
https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2025/jan/29/pete-hegseth-creates-new-pentagon-task-force-ban-r/
https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/3302523/trump-executive-orders-military-excellence/
https://www.npr.org/2025/01/28/nx-s1-5277155/trump-military-transgender-dei-iron-dome-orders
https://freebeacon.com/latest-news/die-dei-trump-signs-executive-order-banning-woke-program-in-military/
https://www.defenseone.com/policy/2025/01/hegseth-stands-anti-dei-task-force/402623/
https://www.stripes.com/theaters/us/2025-01-30/hegseth-dei-defense-department-promotions-academies-16654199.html
https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-dod-creates-task-force-abolish-dei-offices-promote-systemic-racism
https://thehill.com/policy/defense/5129386-west-point-cadet-clubs-ordered-disband/
https://www.stripes.com/branches/air_force/2025-03-20/air-force-base-dei-compliance-visits-17205950.html
https://www.expressnews.com/news/article/dei-hegseth-trump-military-dei-air-force-20230989.php
https://san.com/cc/naval-academy-removes-close-to-400-books-linked-to-dei-following-dod-order/
https://www.fedweek.com/armed-forces-news/dod-task-force-visiting-installations-to-observe-dei-rollback/
https://www.iheart.com/content/2025-02-06-west-point-shuts-down-campus-clubs-related-to-race-gender-amid-dei-attacks/
https://www.campusreform.org/article/hegseth-orders-end-affirmative-action-admissions-service-academies/27419
https://thehill.com/policy/defense/5114409-pence-hegseth-military-promotions-race-sex/

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of senior Department officials concerning the Department's policies and programs.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior Department officials. Disclosing the policies and other information would demonstrate the bases for those decisions, which have attracted substantial public attention, as demonstrated by the articles cited above. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Washington Public Records Act Request: Personnel and Conduct Records (Jefferson County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington Public Records Act Request: Personnel and Conduct Records (Jefferson County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, I respectfully request copies of the following records covering the past ten (10) years:

Employee Information:
•	Personnel Rosters: Full list of current and former officers and staff, including names, badge numbers, 
ranks/positions, assignments, hiring dates, lengths of service, and current salaries.
•	Separated Personnel Records: Officer names, badge numbers, ranks/positions, dates of separation, reasons for separation, and any disciplinary or investigation findings related to separated employees.
•	Internal Affairs Complaints Logs: Logs of complaints filed against officers, including dates, nature of complaints, investigation summaries, and outcomes.
•	Demographic Breakdown of Staff: Information regarding race, gender, age, and years of service for all personnel.
•	Disciplinary Records: Records of sustained misconduct, reprimands, suspensions, demotions, and terminations.
•	Citizen Complaint Records: Complaints filed by members of the public, including investigation records and findings.
•	Officer Training Records: Records of completed certifications, dates of training courses, and ongoing education.
•	Use of Force Reports: Reports and records detailing any incidents where physical force was used, including the type of force (firearms, tasers, batons, etc.).
•	Officer-Involved Shooting Reports: Investigative files and administrative reviews regarding officer-involved shootings.
•	Early Intervention System (EIS) Data: Records identifying officers flagged for multiple complaints, use of force incidents, or other concerning behavior.
•	Performance Evaluations: Annual or biannual performance reviews for individual officers.
•	Grievance Records: Labor grievances filed by or against officers.
•	Supervisor Notes and Counseling Records: Informal disciplinary notes and performance counseling documentation.
•	Resignation and Retirement Records: Records detailing reasons for resignations or retirements, especially after critical incidents.
•	Awards and Commendations: Records of any awards, commendations, or honors given to officers.
•	Off-Duty Misconduct Records: Records involving arrests or disciplinary actions related to off-duty behavior.
•	Records of Lawsuits Against Officers: Civil suits alleging officer misconduct, civil rights violations, or other professional conduct matters.
•	Settlement Agreements Involving Officers: Terms and details of any settlement agreements, including any non-disclosure clauses.
•	Brady Lists: Lists or notifications identifying officers with documented credibility issues.
•	Body-Worn Camera Misuse or Policy Violation Records: Instances where officers failed to comply with body-worn camera policies.
•	Records of Transfers and Reassignments: Records regarding officer transfers or reassignments, including reasons where available.
•	Fitness-for-Duty Evaluations: Psychological or medical evaluations required after misconduct allegations or other triggering events.
•	Promotions and Demotions Records: Application materials, evaluation records, and decision memorandums regarding promotions and demotions.
•	Employment Application Materials: Initial applications, resumes, background check summaries (redacted for private information if necessary).
•	Secondary Employment Approvals: Records showing agency approval for secondary employment by officers (e.g., security jobs).
•	Internal Memos Regarding Conduct Policy Changes: Memos or correspondence discussing changes to conduct policies, disciplinary procedures, or related codes.
•	Salary Records: Current and historical salary data for all personnel, including base pay, overtime, special assignment pay, and bonuses.

Format and Fees:
In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (CSV file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

Please produce the records in electronic format (.csv, .xlsx, .ods, etc.) via email or secure download link to avoid unnecessary copying costs.

If the total estimated cost to fulfill this request exceeds $25, please provide a written, itemized cost estimate before proceeding. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.120(2)(b), I request a waiver or reduction of fees as this request is made for the purpose of public interest and community oversight, not for commercial purposes.

If Portions Are Exempt:
If any portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide a written explanation for each redaction or withheld record, citing the specific exemption relied upon.

If Delayed or Denied:
If fulfillment of this request will take longer than the statutory time frame, or if you believe any aspect is overly burdensome, please provide a written explanation identifying specifically which portions are burdensome and propose a timeline for rolling production of records as they become available.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this request. Please feel free to contact me at [Insert Your Email] if clarification is needed.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

title: DOJ investigation records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOJ investigation records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Investigation records pertaining to the multiple inquiries into entities that have "misled the public about the long-term side effects of chemical and surgical mutilation under the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act," pursuant to Executive Order 14187, “Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation.”

Under the FOIA Improvement Act of 2016, agencies must adopt a presumption of disclosure, withholding information “only if . . . disclosure would harm an interest protected by an exemption” or “disclosure is prohibited by law.”

The FOIA Improvement Act of 2016 also amended the FOIA as follows (5 USC 552(a)(8)):

(A) An agency shall—
(i) withhold information under this section only if—
(I) the agency reasonably foresees that disclosure would harm an interest protected by an exemption described in subsection (b); or
(II) disclosure is prohibited by law; and
(ii) (I) consider whether partial disclosure of information is possible whenever the agency determines that a full disclosure of a requested record is not possible; and
(II) take reasonable steps necessary to segregate and release nonexempt information. . .

In the event some portions of the requested records are properly exempt from disclosure, please disclose any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the requested records. If it is your position that a document contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. Claims of nonsegregability must be made with the same degree of detail as required for claims of exemptions in a Vaughn index. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

Further, “the withholding agency must supply ‘a relatively detailed justification, specifically identifying the reasons why a particular exemption is relevant and correlating those claims with the particular part of a withheld document to which they apply.’”

In addition, I ask that your agency exercise its discretion to release records which may be technically exempt, but where withholding serves no important public interest. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

If a portion of the responsive records become available before the entire request is complete, I respectfully request that the DOJ provide records on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

To Whom It May Concern:

Guidance documents prepared by the DOJ regarding enforcement of 18 U.S.C. § 116, prioritizing protection against female genital mutilation, pursuant to Section 8 of Executive Order 14187, “Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation.”

title: Information Involving  Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (9/23/2022)

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving  Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (9/23/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all police and arrest reports related to the traffic stop and subsequent arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" for OUI charges on or around September 23, 2022. The Charge Case Number is "22-664-AR".

Any mugshot photo related to the arrest of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Westbrook Police Department personnel during the initial stop, field sobriety testing, detention, arrest, and transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All dash camera footage from any patrol vehicles involved in the stop, detention, or transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident.

If portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Brass

title: HHS eliminated grants

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: HHS eliminated grants
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of the 215 grants eliminated by HHS to "immediately take appropriate steps to ensure that [medical] institutions receiving federal research or education grants end the chemical and surgical mutilation of children," in compliance of Executive Order 14187, “Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation.” Each entry should include the following information: 

i. the grant amount
ii. the grant recipient 
iii. the grant's purpose

Examples include:  a $1,319,024 grant to the Center for Innovative Public Health research for “#TranscendantHealth – Adapting an LGB+ inclusive teen pregnancy prevention program for transgender boys;” and a $5,955,310 grant to Boston Children’s Hospital for “TransHealthGUIDE: Transforming Health for Gender-Diverse Young Adults Using Intervention to Drive Equity.”

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. title: HHS WPATH documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: HHS WPATH documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All rescinded or amended policies and documents that rely on the “Standards of Care Version 8” developed by the World Professional Association for Transgender Health, rescinded or amended to comply with Executive Order 14187, “Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation." This includes but is not limited to the federal guidance titled “Gender-affirming Care and Young People,” as well as content from HHS webpages. 

I am requesting both the original versions of these records and what was restored to comply with the Feb. 14 court order that compelled HHS to redisplay the content. The restored versions will contain "a notice that (HHS) disavows ... all materials that cite WPATH ... in the strongest possible terms."

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I'm requesting body cam footage from all officers at accident scene on March 26.2025 7:50am 8am on linebaugh ave and plantation blvd tampa fl 33624
Reporting agency case # 25-307560
Crash number 89433066

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jose alvarado

title: Fort Worth Police Department NYC trip receipts | Sally Mann

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Fort Worth Police Department NYC trip receipts | Sally Mann
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All receipts incurred for FWPD's trip to New York City in its investigation of the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth.

According to a 4/28/25/ Fort Worth Report story, trip expenses included $2,506.92 for the officers’ lodging, $1,694.85 for airfare, $47 for parking at DFW Airport, $670 for museum entry fees, and $2,070 per diem. I am requesting copies of the receipts that constituted these expenses.

2) FWPD's most recent policy protocol on work travel expenses. (Per a  4/28/25 Fort Worth Report story, a spokesperson said "Trip expenses were covered following our policy protocols").

If you determine that some but not all the information we’ve requested is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, I ask that you redact it for the time being and make the rest available on a rolling basis. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage, and therefore we request that you waive any costs.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: bdavis@star-telegram.com) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM. 

Sincerely,

Bradford Davis

communications.subject: Police Open Records Request :: P008608-042825
communications.communication:
Dear Bradford  Davis: 
 Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of Fort Worth, Texas. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office and given the log number P008608-042825 for tracking purposes. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 

 Public Information Administrator
